abstracts.cdata!:
This project is the follow-on to the
            IDA-financed Eritrea HIV/AIDS/STI, Malaria and Tuberculosis
            Control Project (HAMSET) (report no. 28994). HAMSET II aims
            to: (1) contain the spread o f HIV/AIDS/STI in vulnerable
            groups as well as the general population through a focused
            multi-sectoral approach, with renewed attention to the most
            vulnerable populations; (2) expand the coverage of directly
            observed treatment (DOT), improve case detection and
            treatment outcomes for TB; (3) reduce or at least maintain
            malaria mortality and morbidity at the current low levels;
            (4) improve the coverage o f effective Reproductive Health
            (RH) interventions; and (5) strengthen the overall health
            system, including human resources for health, to enable the
            country to better address HAMSET diseases. The project has
            four components: 1. Multi-Sectoral Response: This component
            supports key (non-health) line ministries and civil society
            organizations at both national and zoba level to scale up
            prevention (especially behavior change communication and
            stigma reduction), care and support interventions for
            HIV/AIDS/STI, malaria, TB and reproductive health (RH) (with
            emphasis on mobilizing communities to utilize health
            services). 2. Health Sector Response: This has five
            sub-components: HIV/AIDS/STI TB, malaria, RH, and Human
            Resources for Health. Each o f the first four sub-components
            will comprise three activity categories: (a) Human resources
            for HAMSET diseases: HAMSET II will improve human Improve
            the information base for decision making; (b) Scale up
            prevention interventions; and (c) Scale up diagnostic,
            treatment, care and support services; 3. Community Managed
            HAMSET Response Program: As a continuation of HAMSET's
            Community-Managed HAMSET Response Program, this component
            aims to scale up and consolidate community-driven
            initiatives to address HAMSET diseases including
            reproductive health. 4. Project management and coordination,
            capacity building, monitoring and evaluation, and Innovation
            and new policy development.
